channel.title: How do you title your tracks? (What’s your style)?
channel.description:
I find it interesting how different artists use different motifs to title their tracks. Me personally I like to name my tracks about how I’m feeling, or things that have happened to me. for example: Cureless pain, young love hurts, fully torn. or generally things to do with space or where a track sounds like it’s going. For example: New Dimension, beyond, gone wild
What do you use to create a title?

item.title: How do you title your tracks? (What’s your style)?
item.dc:creator: R-JRDN
item.description:
The process i like to go through to name a song is imagine a music video that would go with the song. I imagine the story that would go with the song and try to base it off the main ‘feel’ of the track. Then i try to make my song title based on the video idea i came up with. However, sometimes the title is taken straight from what the song sounds like. My song ‘Cascade’ was named after the main melody. https://soundcloud.com/r-jrdn/cascade

Read full topic
item.source: How do you title your tracks? (What’s your style)?

item.dc:creator: sideswipeBL
item.description:
piano (verb)ing (noun)
eg. piano falling down stairs, piano looking at the menu
for remixes it’s just the name of the original and the word “remix”

item.description:

item.title: How do you title your tracks? (What’s your style)?
item.dc:creator: VJM
item.description:
I like naming my tracks off of the most random things. Like, the most random things ever. For instance one was named “valley_jpg” (the track had nothing to do with a valley!), another was “vision seq.” (Once again, no resemblance!). Maybe im just really creative. Maybe I’m super weird. I don’t know.

Read full topic

item.source: How do you title your tracks? (What’s your style)?

item.title: How do you title your tracks? (What’s your style)?
item.dc:creator: NotMiles
item.description:
I try to create an atmosphere with music, so my titles give a name to give a name to the “place/event/feeling” I just created (Usually added after finishing a song or midway through making it).
Or I just pick a cool word and write a song about it.

I’ve only titled a song about my own emotions once (I Feel Like I Can Fly)

Read full topic
item.source: How do you title your tracks? (What’s your style)?

item.title: How do you title your tracks? (What’s your style)?
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
Cheddr:

Or what lyrics could be to the hook if I had vocals

I’ve used that approach before too.
Generally stumble on something that works rhythmically with a significant detail of the track.

That said, a few of my tracks are intended to end up as vocal tracks, so I’m partly just thinking ahead, based on thematic moods, etc…

Read full topic
item.source: How do you title your tracks? (What’s your style)?

item.title: How do you title your tracks? (What’s your style)?
item.dc:creator: Cheddr
item.description:
Either

  • take a nap listening to the song. Then what is literally the first thing that pops into your head when you are partially awake

  • words that would fit the rhythm of the melody. Or what lyrics could be to the hook if I had vocals

  • use the first letters from the auto generated title and use that as a starting off point for word association to fit the mood of the song. For a made up example: Moody cow —> more clouds -> Mostly overcast, or maybe rain, or must be grey.

Read full topic
item.source: How do you title your tracks? (What’s your style)?

item.title: How do you title your tracks? (What’s your style)?
item.dc:creator: Sunny
item.description:
Usually I’ll have some sort of feeling from it as I’m making it, then when I’m listening to the last few mixes, I’ll start to see some sort of imagery in my head. If I had the time to animate, I would probably make a lot of fantasy music videos for them.

So I title my songs based on the strongest scene in my head.

Read full topic
item.source: How do you title your tracks? (What’s your style)?

item.title: How do you title your tracks? (What’s your style)?
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
I name it ‘Sketch’ and then add a number that’s 1 higher than the last track that I called ‘Sketch’.

Read full topic
